Mythic Zoroastrianism

62827.name: Sub Rosa (Issue 5 - Jun 2009)
62827.description:
Table of Contents

Regular Columns
Under the Rose
News from the Line Editor
Who’s Who?

Features
Hermetic Cocktails
Beyond the Fields We Know
Dar al-Nujum Covenant
The Invisible World
The Poppele
Tribunals At Play
The Bishop’s Bird

62828.name: Parole
62828.description: The object of this game is to make the most out of life while in confinement through rehabilitation,(getting educated working and earning money) paying the consequences for your previous actions and then getting paroled and released with an education and trying to have enough money to be able to survive on the outside world without being confined again.

62831.name: Delver's Pack
62831.description:
From back of box:

This box contains new material for the Tunnels & Trolls v7.5 game. HUNTING PARTY is a GM adventure for Dwarves, Elves or Men. TERRoR is a deadly solo adventure for really tough characters. MONSTRUM CODEX II and CODEX INCANTATUM II provide new monsters and higher level spells to extend and enhance the original v7.5 release. Additional dice and a character pad provide all the tools necessary to enhance one of the oldest RPGS on Earth!

REQUIRES THE USE OF TUNNELS & TROLLS v7.5

62832.name: Rêve: The Dream Ouroboros
62832.description:
From the book:

It's dangerous to play with Dragons....Does adventure mean more to you than hack & slay, dungeon crawling, and Min/Maxxing? Feel like you are drowning in a tired sea of character classes, races, spells, and rules rules rules?

What game do you dream in?Welcome to Rêve: the Dream Ouroboros a world of high roleplaying and oneiric adventure. Rêve is a skill based roleplaying game with a revolutionary action resolution system that allows the players to play their characters, not have to juggle supplementary rule books.

Rêve features a unique dream-based magic system consisting of Four Draconic Ways: Hypnos, Oneiros, Narcos, and Thanatos; a truly deadly combat system; and 14 humanoid races and 90+ creatures. This book contains everything you need to play or run a game. Also included are 3 poetic adventures that enable you to start your Rêve gaming today!

Rêve: the Dream Ouroboros - - the dream you game in.

62833.name: Make a Movie
62833.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

62834.name: Fishing Tournament
62834.description:
Fishing Tournament is a fun, fast fishing game for 2 to 5 people.

You are entered into a Fishing Tournament! If you can't catch the most, then try to catch the biggest fish. Once a player reaches their limit of five, it is time to measure and see who is the best fisherman.

Game includes:
96 cards (including Locations, 3 different types of fish to catch, Bait, on surprises to play on the other fishermen), 2 Dice and instructions.

62837.name: Die drei ??? und die Masken der Dämonen
62837.description: The players move through a forest, trying to find the demons' masks in different hideouts. On some of the fields there are chips which a player can turn around when he or she reaches that field. Some force the player to draw an event card and follow the instructions on it; others give hints about a certain hideout. If a player has four hints for one hideout, he or she can move there and pick up a mask card which has a point value. The player with the highest valued mask cards at the end of the game is the winner.

62838.name: Envirochallenge
62838.description: Envirochallenge is a trivia game for 2-6 people. It comes with fancy plastic figurines of various animals for the player pawns. The question cards are quarters of a projection of the globe, such that a set of four makes Earth. There are several decks, and some cards are auctioned.

62839.name: Terror Network
rpghonor: 2012 Indie RPG Award - Supplement of the Year - Runner-Up
62839.description:
Subtitle: Counter Terrorism Role Playing Game

Publisher Blurb:

From the mountains of Afghanistan to the streets of Boston, fight on the front lines against Terrorist Networks like Al-Qaeda. You and your fellow agents are the nation’s unsung heroes in the War on Terror.

With 42 skills and a gritty, high body count system, Terror Network is sure to get your adrenaline pumping. It supports investigation-based campaigns, combat-based campaigns, or a combination of both.

62841.name: Homestead: Guide to Frontier Life
62841.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Howdy partner, welcome to the family ranch. It ain’t much, but its home. And it ain’t easy either, I’ll tell you that much ‘migo. Forget what you read in those back east dime novels. Life out here isn’t all about shoot outs at high noon and stage coaches getting robbed. It’s about moving two miles of cattle across dangerous terrain and spending two months on horseback. It’s about gold rushes and sod busters, boomtowns and cattle barons. This is the way the west was won.

Homestead is a sourcebook for players and GM’s who want to transport their characters into the world of classic TV westerns. This book details the genre of dramatic westerns set on small farms and sprawling cattle ranches. Most people envision the Old West as a place filled with gunslingers and cold blooded killers. While the western frontier did have a noticeably violent streak to it, most settlers and homesteaders faced a different array of problems. The some of the more popular television westerns of old sought to capture this dramatic struggle for survival set amidst the epic background that is the Wild West

The villains you face may be cut throats, gamblers, and outlaws, but they may just as well be slimy politicians, scheming cattle barons, and smooth talking con artists. Life on the open frontier means that there is always a problem to be solved and a new obstacle to overcome. The weather, wild animals, and the land itself are constant challenges.

The ties of loyalty, friendship, and family are often strained but they never break. Dramatic westerns often center their stories on the themes of family and working together. The frontier family making a life for itself on the wild plains is a quintessential component of the western mythos.

This book contains everything you need to give your campaign the flavor of classic TV westerns.


An introduction to the central themes of the genre.
How to build a dramatic western campaign.
Brief historical overview of the Old West.
Overviews of the western territories and famous trails.
Plot hooks and random encounters
Game rule information for tweaking the d20 rules.
New skills, feats, and drawbacks.
A sample setting complete with NPCs and adventure setups.

62843.name: Once Upon A Time: A Guide to Fairy Tales (OGL 3.5)
62843.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Once upon a time, in a land far, far away...

Fairy Tales is your guide to playing in the surreal and often macabre world of fairy tales. Many of us are familiar with the cartoony, G-rated versions of classic fairy tales, perhaps thinking that these stories are meant for the entertainment of children. However, a few know the terrible and bloody genre of the original folk tales that these "family friendly" stories are based on. Prepare to journey to a strange and but bizarrely familiar land of danger and treachery. The fairy tale campaign is a place where the world of ordinary life collides head first with the world of evil villains and frightening supernatural powers, a world that too often shows us the dark side of human nature.

A game master will find everything that he or she needs to transport the characters to a world where the fantastic and the ordinary collide. There is a big difference between a folk story and an epic fantasy. While there are many books out there that can help you build an epic fantasy, this book is focused on the wondrous and often frightening world of fairy tales and folk stories. Whether your fairy tale is set in a nameless Renaissance village or the mean streets of a modern city, everything you need to bring your adventure to life is right here.

Players will be able to get the most out of their fairy tale characters with new advanced classes. The book also includes new skills and feats, as well as an in depth discussion of which skills and feats are most useful in a fairy tale game.

Fairy Tales provides gamers with:


GM advice for capturing the feel of the fairy tale genre, including common themes, the elements of a fairy tale, and the fairy tale setting.
Talking animals and fairy tale monsters
Random Encounter Chart with four custom NPCs
Six new Advanced Classes
New Skills and Feats
New Drawbacks
Fifty random storylines for the fairy tale genre


This book is compatible with the Modern d20 rulebook.

62844.name: Looking Good
62844.description:
This is Game 5 in an 8 game Life Skills series of board games.

Basically a roll & move that is designed to promote learning to improve one's appearance. Presented in a creative,fun-to-play format that encourages socialization and positive behavioral reactions from the participants while offering basic life skills instruction. The program focuses on skills needed o assist individuals' move toward independence.

62845.name: Drama: Soap Opera Sourcebook
62845.description:
Publisher Blurb:

You want drama?

Drama is your ticket to the melodrama and suspense of a soap opera campaign. This book gives you everything you need to introduce emotional entanglements and twisted personal relationships to your favorite role playing games. Whether your characters are a family of ancient wizards or a group of bored teenagers, Drama will help you delve into the petty schemes and bitter vendettas that are the hallmark of a melodramatic campaign.

This book has everything a game master needs to immerse the characters in a world of cat fights, old rivalries, lost loves, and emotional breakdowns. A GM can use the materials presented here to create a campaign straight of the daytime soaps or incorporate melodramatic plots into any other genre of role-playing game. Running a dramatic campaign is much different than a campaign that is centered on action and beating the bad guys. Social interaction and the personal lives of the characters are the primary drivers of events in the game. This book can help a GM to deal with the revolving storylines, cliff hangers, and open ended plots.

If you want to customize your character to fit into a soap opera setting then you need look no further. Advanced classes, feats, and drawbacks are all here to round out your soap opera characters and give him or her the edge in social situations.

Drama provides gamers with:

GM advice for capturing the feel of the soap opera genre, including secrets, seduction, romance, tragedy, and more!
Plot hooks and melodramatic storylines
A random encounter chart with three custom NPCs
Six new Advanced Classes
New Feats
New Drawbacks
Ashbury Heights: A sample setting perfect for any game of psychological drama or supernatural mystery
Adventure set ups set in the disturbing town of Ashbury Heights




This book is compatible with the Modern d20 rulebook.

62846.name: Argh!: The Guide to Pirates
62846.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Arr...the sea be a harsh mistress

Pirates is your gateway to adventure and excitement on the high seas. This book has everything you need to create a campaign based on a world of villainous pirates, dashing buccaneers, back stabbing double crossers, and every other type of scallywag that ever sailed the seven seas. This book covers every aspect of the pirate campaign; villains, heroes, vague morality, treasure, betrayal, and everything else you’d expect from a game about cutthroat buccaneers. Whether your pirates are raiding the Caribbean or sailing across a fantasy seascape, this book will keep you happy with loads of adventure ideas and character options. Players will find a vast treasure hold of new feats and skills to help them build fearsome pirates and scurvy sea dogs. Game masters will also be happy with the bevy of ideas for building their campaign.

Pirates provides gamers with:


GM advice for building a pirate campaign in multiple styles; historical, quasi-historical, and fantasy.
Plot hooks and random encounters
Four ready made villains
Six new Advanced Classes
New Skills
Dozens of new Feats and Drawbacks
Pirate weapons


This book is compatible with the Modern d20 rulebook.

62847.name: Alien Creation Guide
62847.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tired of playing the alien races that someone else has created? Why not make your own?

Alien Creation contains everything you could every need to build your own player-ready alien races for the Modern d20 rulebook. Whether you are a game master looking to populate your campaign with interesting aliens or a player with your own idea for a unique character, this book have what you need. The point based creation system ensures that all of the alien species made with these rules are roughly equal, each with its own characteristic strengths and weaknesses.
This book has complete rules and advice for making balanced, playable races for your science fiction campaign. The guidelines in this book allow you create anything you can imagine, all without overpowering the other species in your game. The step by step creation process is fast and easy, focusing on the game rule considerations and leaving everything else to your own imagination. The species creation recipe card provides you with a convenient template to record and share your unique alien race.

Do you want a race of warlike plant people or gentle giants with psionic powers? Hyper intelligent machines or dumb brutes with amazing strength? Wings? Claws? Special attacks? Almost any trait you can think of is included in the list of traits that you can buy with your creation points. You can also take racial drawbacks to increase the number of points that you have to spend.

Alien Creation also has tons of advice for rounding out your new aliens. This book covers everything from how they communicate with each other to ideas for creating their physical description and society. Detailing their civilization and culture will be a snap with ready made guidelines that cover aggressiveness, determination, independence, technological development, and more.

Alien Creation provides gamers with:


Advice on creating a species concept
Rules for balancing ability scores
A point based system for buying species traits
Racial skills, feats, and drawbacks
Guidelines for creating the finishing touches to round out your new species and their civilization
Four sample races
Alien racial levels for playing species that are more powerful than standard humanoids


This book is compatible with the Modern d20 rulebook.

62848.name: Markets and Merchandise
62848.description:
Publisher Blurb:

"Two high-priced courtesans, a fine meal, a jug of ale, and a tattoo; the best ten gold pieces you ever spent!"

Markets and Merchandise contains anything and everything that your party of adventuring characters might ever want to buy. From adventuring gear and magical potions to manors and keeps, this book has it all. Luxury items, exotic mounts, fabulous art objects, your players will never run out of things to spend that hard earned gold on. Price ranges vary so the item listing will be useful for high level characters as well as a 1st level party that is just starting out. This work is the ultimate guide to shopping in a fantasy setting. Purchasing items is quick and easy so players won’t have to spend hours digging through price lists or converting prices.

All of the day to day items that populate your fantasy world can be found here. This book contains everything you need to create realistic economic systems in your fantasy world. Currency and barter are discussed, as well as places to buy things new treasure parcels. Use this book to decide what sort of goods and services are available in a given area, give a unique flair to your next treasure, or spice up that next urban encounter. Financial transactions and monetary rewards can be handled in all sorts of ways; this book will give you plenty of ideas for spicing up situations where your characters have to deal with wealth, which is often.
The marketplace or trading post is an essential ingredient to any fantasy setting and this book helps you bring that setting to life with hundreds of different items and dozens of services. Use the things found in this book to define the flavor of a setting by filling in important details and providing a meaningful backdrop for your NPCs.

Markets and Merchandise provides prices and descriptions for the following goods and services:

* Weapons, Armor, and Gear
* Horses and Mounts
* Transport
* Livestock and Animals
* Crops and Wild Plants
* Metals
* Gemstones
* Luxury Items
* Jewelry and Artwork
* Slaves
* Monsters and Rare Animals
* Manufactured Goods
* Clothing
* Musical Instruments
* Eateries and Restaurants
* Food and Drink
* Lodging per Night
* Apartments
* Shops
* Entertainment
* Services
* Financial Services
* Bounties
* Temple Services and Religious Artifacts
* Medical Services and Apothecary
* Potions and Alchemical Items
* Land

This book is compatible with the 4th Edition of the world’s most popular role playing game.

62849.name: Action Hero
62849.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Cars race through the streets and bullets fly endlessly in the world of thrilling fights and non-stop action.

Action Hero contains everything that you need to transport your game into the exhilarating world of your favorite action movies. Car chases, shoot’em ups, and plenty of raw adrenaline are what you’ll find in this high octane genre. This is the ultimate guide for players and game masters who want to crank their action adventure games up to the next level. Action and adventure are the key staples of role-playing games but it can be a challenge to keep up with the pace of an action movie or video game shooter. Running a game of non-stop action and roller coaster thrill presents a GM with unique challenges. Action Hero helps make this easier with advice on crafting plots and capturing the feel of a thrill a minute action movie or first person shooter. Crafting a memorable action sequence isn’t easy but this book provides plenty of ways to help; from plot hooks and pacing to exotic locations and exciting finales. The game never has to slow down as your players wade through endless hordes of henchmen or escape from terrifying monsters.

Players will be able to get the most out of their action characters with new advanced classes. The book also includes new skills and feats, as well as an in depth discussion of which skills and feats are most useful in an action game. You will also find for making a character into an "action star," a special character with unique benefits and disadvantages.

Action Hero provides gamers with:


GM advice for capturing the feel of the action genre; including the script, pacing, cliffhangers, action sequences, the cast, and more!
Six new Advanced Classes
New Skills and Feats
New Drawbacks
Random Encounter Chart with four custom NPCs
Major villains with complete stats, perfect for any action game
Fifty random storylines for the action genre


This book is compatible with the Modern d20 rulebook.

62850.name: Far Avalon
62850.description:
User Summary: Generic Sci-Fi setting for any rpg.

Publisher Blurb:

Far Avalon
A complete SF game setting from Avenger Enterprises and ComStar Games

Far Avalon
Until ten years ago, the Far Avalon region was a backwater on the edge of uncharted space. Linked to the distant Home Worlds by the Translight Conduit at Lubeck, the region was home to dozens of colonies and small independent states overseen by the Colonial District Authority.

The Event
A decade ago, the Lubeck conduit failed for unknown reasons, cutting off Far Avalon from the rest of human space. Now each faction, each alliance and each government must chart its own course into an uncertain future.

The Old Order Collapses
Each colony is thrown back on its own resources. Now, with the navy gone, a handful of corvettes is a battlefleet, and a world that can build them is a major power. A single cruiser represents a massive naval force. Those that possess such might will emerge as the new leaders in Far Avalon, and those that do not must find other means to secure their future.

Political Turmoil
Some seek to build empires or secure rare resources. Others send out missions to explore the uncharted reaches of space. The remnants of the Colonial District Authority fleet try to maintain order and impose leadership on the fractious states of Far Avalon, but they are few and their ships are worn out.

A Time of Danger
Raiders prey on the colonies of Far Avalon, as rivals seek to conquer them. Factions settle their differences with knives and guns on the backstreets while shady deals are made in the colonial capitals. Space travel is hazardous, but isolation means a slow slide into extinction.

A Time of Opportunity
This is the hour of the independent merchant ship, the mercenary group, and the expert-for-hire. Governments and factions will pay well for expertise and firepower. Adventurers can make their fortune with their wits alone- but one mistake could lead to an early grave.

The Great Questions
Why did the Lubeck conduit fail? What is happening on the far side of it? Has the rest of humanity succumbed to some terrible disaster, or will ships arrive from the Home Worlds tomorrow? There are those who claim that they know the answers- but can they be trusted?

The Far Avalon Game Setting
This book presents a complete and self-contained science-fiction game setting. It includes overview of the region complete with its factions, alliances and states. Dozens of star systems are detailed, containing worlds ranging from frontier colonies to major interstellar powers. The world of Far Avalon itself is presented in great detail, including the intrigue-ridden Freeport of Landing City with its many local factions.

Adventures in Far Avalon
Take command of an exploration starship seeking out other lost enclaves of humans, or an ageing naval cruiser trying to uphold interstellar law in a universe gone mad. Fight for freedom against a burgeoning empire, or raid rival worlds for desperately needed resources to build your own.

Take a berth aboard an independent merchant ship running contraband, or salvage the drifting remains of former fleet warships. Seek answers to the great questions in forgotten temples and ruins on airless worlds, or try to make a living in the sleazy freeports of the independent colonies.

The old order has collapsed. Now is your chance to build the new one...or to tear it down.

62852.name: Welt der Türme
62852.description:
Translated from the publisher's game page:

Towers have always been symbols of power and freedom. In this game towers give the knights the opportunity to find their way to the goal. They are not tied to a fixed location or a fixed set of rules; they have the freedom to find a place anywhere on the game board. This creates a fascinating landscape for the knights among the towers – a world of towers.

Whoever first manages to move his knight to the opponent's start line wins. The road to travel is always on the towers, upon which you can freely move. The higher the tower, the farther the jump...

62853.description:
JAB is a skill-centric strategic boxing card game. In JAB, you get direct control over your boxer's fists, providing an experience as close as possible to real boxing without getting punched in the face. JAB is played in real-time, meaning there are no turns.


Winning the game

To win the game, get a knockout by throwing staggering haymakers at your opponent until he eats canvas, or strategically win more rounds than your opponent by impressing the judges with your beautiful technique.


How is JAB different?

JAB attempts to innovate the real-time genre by challenging a player to be constantly making decisions, rather than simply recognizing patterns or performing calculations. The game also measures your ability to calmly manage your focus in a chaotic situation.
62853.name: JAB: Realtime Boxing
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

62854.name: Humpty Dumpty's Wall Game
62854.description:
From back of Box

Push the Bricks Out but Don't Let Humpty Dumpty Fall! Build the Wall. Remove the Bricks. Be Careful!

Decide who starts. Take turns to push out the bricks. The loser is the player who makes Humpty Dumpty fall.

This is an new Australian version similar to the old Humpty Dumpty.

From the Toy Story 3 edition

Keep Buzz sitting high on his perch with this Toy Story 3 Buzz and the Aliens Wall Game. Build up the wall with the provided bricks and sit Buzz on top of the wall, a bit like Humpty Dumpty. Take it in turns to push out the bricks WITHOUT bumping Buzz off the wall, the first person to make Buzz crash to the floor loses!

62855.name: Zauberenhändler
62855.description:
The trading card game for BGG.Con 2009, based off 2007's Piratenhändler and Sid Sackson's Haggle.

Each card has a person's name, a hint about two other people's ages, and a bonus. Players can turn in a set of five cards: the score is the five ages of the people, plus any bonuses.

62856.description:
As the war intensifies the corporations are looking beyond our planet to gather allies and resources for their plans for domination. Their most obvious targets are the Moon and Ceres, where recently found Golden Cavorita deposits of extraordinary quality have created the "Cavor Fever" in entrepreneurs and executives.

This expansion adds two planetary boards and new markers to the game. Players can now explore the Moon and Ceres by sending agents using two government spaciobuses to travel there. The Moon includes 3 locations to visit and control. Ceres includes 1 new location to control. Also agents can become Directors or Consuls for several locations which give political benefits.

The expansion also includes markers for Golden Cavorita and Victory Points that are awarded for control of several of the locations.
62856.name: Mecanisburgo Expansion 1: Moon and Ceres

62857.name: Nobles of Venice
62857.description:
Nobles of Venice is a rummy game for 2-4 players. Players meld cards in several suits representing different Goods and Industries in Venice at the height of its trade power in Renaissance Italy. Unlike most rummy games with fixed values, a market card is used to track the current value of the Goods cards, which are sold for Prestige at the end of each round in the order set by the number of cards left in hand, giving a strong incentive for players to go out quickly.

This game was originally designed for Cate108's rummy design contest here on BGG.

62858.name: Last Stand at Baku
62858.description: During the summer of 1918, Turkey created its “Army of Islam” con-sisting of the 5th, 15th Divisions, later the 10th also joined. Having been defeated in Palestine, the Turks looked for easier prey and this was the Trancaucasus-Caspian area of Azerbaijan. This newly formed country asked Turkey for protection from the Bolsheviks, which also wanted the area. The Reds were defeated in late June but they remained in control of Baku until mid July. Turkey, like the British, saw Baku’s worth in its oil and ordered its army to march hundreds of miles to seize it despite Germany’s strong protests (who wanted it also through political means). By the end of July, the Turks were fast approaching Baku. This prompted the British to send Dunsterforce, 1000 men, to Baku, all arrived in the nick of time. The situation for the British was dire from the start. In manpower, the odds were 10 to 1 in favor of the Turks!

62859.description:
Iraq 1941 is a conflict simulation of the 1941 British invasion of Iraq. Also known as the Anglo-Iraqi War, this was a struggle for critical oil fields that could spell doom for Great Britain if lost. Outnumbered two to one on the ground and in the air, the British defeated the Iraqi army and their German allies in a free-wheeling air and ground campaign. Can you do the same? Iraq 1941 is a two-player game, or it can be played solitaire.

Game Features

* Two-Person or Solitaire Play
* Eight-Page Rules Manual
* Rules Include a Variant Scenario and Variant Counters
* Game Mechanics for Air and Land Combat
* 24 x 17 Hex Game Map in Full Color by Map Artist Richard Dengel
* Map Comes in Large (12 8.5" x 11" Sheets) and Small (One 17" x 11" Sheet or Two 8.5" x 11" Sheet) Formats with Large and Small Counters
* 92 Beautiful Playing Pieces by Counter Artist Tom Cundiff
* Map, Counters and Rules Available in PDF Format
* Player Aid Card and Setup/Reinforcements Charts
62859.name: Iraq 1941

62860.name: Australian Realms (Issue 20 - Nov 1994)
62860.description:
Contents

The Heat of War - Battletech fiction
Wraith Poster
Doomed City - Unae
Heroic Women
What to Pack in Your Backpack
Castell Harlech
Apocalypse Here
Shadowrun Australia

Editorial
Letters
Reviews
Dice are Dead
The Analytical Engine
The Adventures of the A-Team Comic
News

62861.description:
Drakar och Demoner - Brädspelet is a Swedish fantasy adventure board game based on the latest incarnation of the oldest and most popular Swedish role playing game; Drakar och Demoner Trudvang (7th & 8th Editions).

The object of the game is to uncover secrets of the forest Vildhjarta, by conquering any of the twelve of the forest's guardians. The more you secrets you learn, the easier it is for you to convince the dragon Elmtunga to fly you out of the forest on its back.

During the game, the player meets friends and foes in the different parts of the woods, while the forest does its best to stop the adventurers from learning its secrets.

The game is currently only available in Swedish.
62861.name: Drakar och Demoner: Brädspelet

62862.name: Komm mit durch Deutschland!
62862.description:
Komm mit durch Deutschland! is a trivia game for children focusing on German cities and other places of interest. Players draw cards with towns, popular sights or landmarks from a number of cards placed next to the board. The place on the card should be very close to a neutral figure on the game board which is a map of Germany.

After that, the cards are turned and you can see where the places really are and the players put their figures on that place on the board. The player who has his figure closest to the neutral figure can answer a question to get closer to this figure. If he can't answer the question, the second player can answer the question and so on. After that, the closest players score points.

The game includes two maps of Germany: a more detailed map with cities and rivers on it, and another one without it.

62864.name: ¿Quién es?
62864.description:
This game is designed for beginning Spanish language students in middle or high school.

The object of the game is to be the first person to figure out the following information:
1. Who is the new person in town?
2. Where is the new person located in the town?
3. How is the new person feeling right now?

Contents:

The game board is a generic town with at least eight locations on the board. Players will travel through the town by moving through spaces on the board. There are four parts to the board: Top Left, Bottom Left, Top Right, and Bottom Right.
The die is used to determine who goes first and how many spaces are moved during a turn.
The mystery cards: There are 24 ¿Quien es? Cards.
The 15 "Ventura" (chance) cards are opportunities. When a player lands on a chance spot, another player reads him a card. If answered correctly there is a reward for the game. The are 15 "ventura cards: Ventura Cards
The 6 markers ( one per player ) are chosen at the beginning of the game.
The check lists are used to try and solve the mystery. By process of elimination, a person will eventually be able to solve the mystery. Everyone needs a check list: Check Lists.
The pencils are used in conjunction with the game sheets.
The envelope is used to keep the mystery a secret.

62865.name: Race For The Master's
62865.description:
The goal of the game is to graduate with a master's degree from the Educational Technology Department at San Diego State University.

Players must complete 10 classes and all requirements of the Master's degree in the Ed Tech department at SDSU. Points are gathered on the way in the form of awards, portfolio pieces, jobs, and published papers. The winner is the person who has the most points at the end of the game.

62867.description:
Strangely, Johann Rüttinger published two games under the same name at Noris within a few years of each other (this one is from the late eighties).
In this game, up to four players roll a die and put the item they rolled onto a stick that their large wooden mouse holds. The first player to get all the different items (sausages, cheese, grapes etc.) on his or her mouse's stick is the winner.
62867.name: Die frechen Mäuse

62868.name: Polignac
62868.description:
This game is strongly related to Knaves. It is played with a standard deck of cards after removing all the cards with value less than 7. Taking the Jacks worth one or two penalty points, the game continues until a player reaches an agreed total of penalties.
There are some possibilities to change the whole structure of the game, for example any player may bid "capot" before the opening lead is made. This is an undertaking to win every trick. If succeeded, each opponent loses 5 points, if not the bidder loses 5.

62869.name: Lone Wolf Club Newsletter (Issue 1 - 1985)
62869.description:
User summary of articles in this newsletter:

Future Releases: previewing Book 03: The Caverns of Kalte.
Lone Wolf Club Competition: a crossword based on characters and events from Book 01: Flight from the Dark and Book 02: Fire on the Water.

boardgameimplementation: Batman: The Animated Series Dice Game
boardgamehonor: 2010 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
2010 Origins Awards Best Family, Party or Children's Game Nominee
2010 Origins Awards Best Family, Party or Children's Game Winner
2011 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
62871.description:
Eat brains. Don't get shotgunned.

In Zombie Dice, you are a zombie. You want braaains – more brains than any of your zombie buddies. The 13 custom dice are your victims. Push your luck to eat their brains, but stop rolling before the shotgun blasts end your turn! Whoever collects 13 brains first wins. Each game takes 10 to 20 minutes and can be taught in a single round.

Each turn, you take three dice from the box and roll them. A brain symbol is worth one point at the end of the round, while footsteps allow you to reroll this particular dice. Shotgun blasts on the other hand are rather bad, cause if you collect three shotgun blasts during your turn, it is over for you and you get no points. After rolling three dice, you may decide if you want to score your current brain collection or if you want to push your luck by grabbing new dice so you have three again and roll once more.
62871.name: Zombie Dice

62875.name: Pekin Express
62875.description:
Based in a popular spanish TV program by Cuatro, comes Pekin Express, the boardgame.

Players can choose between two diferents rutes: Moscow-Beijing (2008´edition) or Beijing-Bombay (2009´ édition)

As the real adventurers, each player tries to get over diferent trials and get the final goal to win the game


Después del éxito cosechado en televisión, llega el juego de mesa Pekin Express-

Los jugadores podrán escoger entre dos rutas: Moscú-Pekín (de la edición de 2008) o Pekín-Bombay (la ruta de esta temporada)

Como los aventureros en la realidad, los jugadores deberán superar diferentes pruebas para alcanzar la meta final

"New Wurld Order"

62881.name: Count to Ten with Cowboys and Indians
62881.description:
Fun while learning to count.

This is a simple arithmetic game for from one to five players. The game provides five playing boards and sixty playing pieces (3 - Cowboys, 30 - Indians). By playing easy games the child learns: 1. To count to ten. 2. Simple addition. 3. Simple subtraction.

62883.name: Lone Wolf Club Newsletter (Issue 2 - 1985)
rpgissuearticle: Special 'Collector's Edition' Lone Wolf T-Shirt Offer
62883.description:
User summary of articles in this newsletter:

News from the Kai Monastery: previewing Book 04: The Chasm of Doom.
Monastery Mail: a selection of letters from Lone Wolf fans.
Lone Wolf Software: an advertisement for the computer games of Book 01: Flight from the Dark and Book 02: Fire on the Water for the Sinclair ZX Spectrum 48K.
Lone Wolf Competition No. 1: winners of the previous newsletter's competition.
Competition Crossword No. 1 Answers: solution to the previous newsletter's competition.
Painting / Drawing Competition: in which entrants are to illustrate a scene from the Lone Wolf books.
Special 'Collector's Edition' Lone Wolf T-Shirt Offer: an advertisement for a limited edition Book 01: Flight from the Dark T-shirt.

62884.name: Lone Wolf Club Newsletter (Issue 3 - 1985)
rpgissuearticle: Lone Wolf Club New Year's Special Bulletin Mini-Quiz Results
The Lone Wolf Club Painting & Drawing Competition
Special 'Collector's Edition' Lone Wolf T-Shirt Offer
62884.description:
User summary of articles in this newsletter:

The Lone Wolf Club Painting & Drawing Competition: winners of the previous newsletter's competition.
Lone Wolf Club New Year's Special Bulletin Mini-Quiz Results: winners of the intervening special newsletter's competition.
The Kai Konnection: a pen-friend listing feature.
Lone Wolf Software: an advertisement for the computer games of Book 01: Flight from the Dark and Book 02: Fire on the Water for the Sinclair ZX Spectrum 48K.

Giak Chat: some background on the Giaks, the breed of evil goblinoids in the service of the Darklords.

62885.name: Lone Wolf Club Newsletter (Special Issue - Summer 1985)
rpgissuearticle: Lone Wolf and the Ice Halls of Terror
62885.description:
User summary of articles in this newsletter:

Monastery Mailbag: a selection of letters from Lone Wolf fans.
The Kai Konnection: a pen-friend listing feature.
Lone Wolf and the Ice Halls of Terror: an advertisement for the computer games of Book 03: The Caverns of Kalte for the Sinclair ZX Spectrum 48K and Commodore 64.
The Lone Wolf T-Shirt: an advertisement for a Book 01: Flight from the Dark T-shirt.
